sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: I heard a really funny joke last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上我听到一个非常有趣俄语卷舌音的笑话。

sentences.english: This thesis presents a research on recognizing the retroflex and non- retroflex speech sounds for Mandarin Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 本论文是针对华语卷舌音与非卷舌音辨识之研究。

sentences.english: This thesis presents a research on recognizing the retroflex and non- retroflex speech sounds for Mandarin Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 本论文是针对华语卷舌音与非卷舌音辨识之研究。

sentences.english: I don't think it's worth the price.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得它不值这个价卷舌音舌头位置。

definition: retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
alveolar nasal/consonant n produced in the nose with the tongue against the alveolar ridge
velar nasal/consonant ng or ŋ produced in the nose with the back of the tongue against the soft palate
labial consonant
lateral consonant (phonetics)
apical consonant (produced with the tip of the tongue, i.e. d or t)
consonant
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
voiced consonant (linguistics)
vowel
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
vowel
plosive/stop consonant
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
